comment: Easily one of the best Math professors at KSU. No textbook, just a workbook he made that is where all our optional homework is. Four tests where you just need 50 out of 60 points to get a 100, and a quiz almost every Friday. All of his questions on quizzes and exams are pulled straight from his workbook. Take Ritter if you can! He's incredible!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Ok... so I actually never took Prof Ritter but one of my friends referred him to me, I didn't think he'd be willing to teach someone that wasn't one of his students but he was. And he simplified the entire course ODE was initially a very intimidating class but when he teaches you it, its almost as easy as previous math's.
Good professor. His tests are hard, but he is truly caring. He will make sure that you learn the material if you put the effort in.There is no homework. He has one quiz/worksheet day per week.

The class was based off of 4 tests a good amount of quizzes and your attendance, if you managed to get an A before the final he will allow you to exempt it. Overall the class isn't bad but you still need to put the time and effort.
Take this class, if you want to learn. He takes a lot of pride in ensuring your success. You just have to put the work in.

Amazing professor. His lectures are pretty straightforward, and has tons of resources online in case you're struggling or you miss a day (posts daily slides, and even has videos of problems he works out). He's accessible outside of class and is overall one of the best math professors I've ever had.
Take him. He is great.

comment: AMAZING PROF. Very inspiration for math. If you do HW and attend lectures you will get an A. Quizzes to test knowledge on things every Friday but they are over HW. Nice lenient grading system on exams. Even though the class is short, he answers every question. Very accessible out of class. I plan on taking him for linear algebra!

He is the goat fr. Only four exams and a bunch of quizzes, homework is not mandatory but it definitely helps because all of the quizzes and exams are from there. If you have to take diff eq, take it with him

Professor Ritter is a great lecturer. He allows group work while in class which makes class work easy. Before taking his class you should prep on calc 1 and 2 since be will just start teaching as if you already know the topics. He does give office hours but its not very helpful. He doesn't really help if he thinks you know what you're doing.

Mr. Ritter is one of my favorite professors I have taken at KSU. His lectures are informative and the tests and quizzes reflect what he teaches in class. I struggled in this class some, but his resources make it manageable.

comment: Professor Ritter is a fantastic professor. He was very clear in his lectures. He provides so many resources to help you outside of class. The material was overall easy to comprehend. Professor Ritter is an amazing teacher hands down. He should be your first choice. Every exam is a derivative of the homework. It's not rocket science folks. I'm not even that good at math! He definately knows his stuff and is willing to help his students. Offers two grading schemes: 1 with tests and one with homework. If you arent good with tests choose the grading scheme with homework so it can be a decent buffer. he also replaces your lowest test with the final!

Dr. Ritter is honestly such a great professor. His teaching is very in depth and he clearly has a passion for mathematics. Definitely, take him if you have the chance.

comment: He is great at teaching the material. His past tests that he posts are very similar to the ones he will give you. very helpful outside of class also.

hes a good teacher, puts lectures online,  very clear and organized in what he goes over, tests are pretty easy if u study a little bit, ive had him for two math classes and would for more but i dont need anymore, also he seems to care about the students if thats important to u, overall very good teacher one of the best ive had

This class is not the easiest of classes but the professor made it easier. All lectures consists of slide shows of everything coeverd and it is post after each lecture. Professor is very helpful and allows notes on test.

One of the best math prof. at SPSU. Very easy and if you ask questions he explains it in a clear way and doesn't treat you like an idiot or that you should already know it. Awesome. Highly recommended.

Great Professor! He is highly recommendable in my book!

Take him!! He is a great professor, knows what hes talking about. He is very fair when he grades. He gives partial credit which was a great help for me.
